text:
Installation failed when running apache_2.0.44-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi from my 
(F:) drive to install at (c:\apache).

I copied apache_2.0.44-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi from my F: drive to c:\ and ran it 
from there.

Installation worked perfectly.
creator: mww@smcc.edu

text:
What is your F: drive? What OS? Can you provide some more information, please?
Only "Installation failed" is not very helpful ...

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: nd@perlig.de
nd@perlig.de
text:
No further response.
Please reopen this report if you can provide more information.

Thanks.

creator: JDHannan@gmail.com
text:
I am not hte person that originally submitted this bug, but i had the *EXACT* 
same problem

by sheer coincidence i had the .msi file on my f drive, and it wouldnt install
i copied it to the c drive like the guy in the bug said, and it worked 
perfectly too

my f drive is a partition of my raid drive, running windows xp64
the 'exact' problem was that it would get to the part where it would start 
copying files and then say like hey wheres the file, ensure that it still 
exists and u have access to it.

What is the error message you are seeing?
Can you provide some more information, please?
creator: davi@apache.org

text:
Sorry, still not enough clarification.  I can offer that I run this across
drive letters all the time (all local drives, FWIW) and have never encountered
any such behavior.

It's likely to be a problem that Windows installs files in the context of the
system account, and therefore it's lost that drive letter outside of the context
of your user account.  That would be a MSI flaw and not an httpd installer flaw.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
